message.content:
{"id": "13725", "title": "Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor", "description": "When working in the java editor, I observed that the process of reverting a file is significantly slower than closing and reopening the file. Here are the steps to reproduce the issue:", "OB": "1. Answer "no" to the "do you want to save changes" dialog.
2. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
3. Repeat steps 1 and 2.
4. Select "Revert" from the pop-up menu in the editor.", "EB": "This behaviour seems odd because the process of reverting the file contents should not take longer than simply closing and reopening the file.", "SR": "Investigate the code responsible for the "Revert" functionality in the java editor to identify and resolve the performance issue."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '13725', 'title': 'Bug 13725Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.', 'description': 'Bug 13725Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor. ', 'OB': 'answer "no" to the "do you want to save changes" dialog double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select "Revert" from the pop upmenu in the editor it takes15 seconds to replace the contents of the windowwith the original. ', 'EB': 'This seems odd, since reverting the file contents ought notto be more than closing and reopening the file. ', 'SR': ''}
